examples

Class GameObject

  • Object
    • GameObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICollider
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Enemy, Friend

    public abstract class GameObject
extends Object
implements ICollider
    A simple game object for the purposes of demonstrating the collision behavior of ColliDaScope. The class includes an GameObject#update method which would be invoked upon each tick of the game clock for example.
    Author:
    Robert Wilk Created on 5/22/2015.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameObject()
      Constructs the game object at a arbitrary default location.
      GameObject(Point2D.Double location)
      Constructs the game object at the given location.
      GameObject(Point2D.Double location, int size)
      Constructs the game object at the given location and size.
